Text:
Today we remember Ahmaud Arbery. Yesterday, his killers were found guilty of federal hate crimes - an important outcome, but true justice would be Ahmaud still with his family today.

It's on all of us to continue the fight against racism and hatred in all of its forms. https://t.co/MmuC8vrBnn

Today is #AAPIEqualPayDay - the number of days into 2022 that Asian American & Pacific Islander women must work to earn what their white male counterparts made in 2021. 

We cannot let the pay disparity continue. It's time to ensure #equalpay for equal work.
Salúd to #NationalMargaritaDay at Rialto in the original Las Vegas! https://t.co/YFG8cp1c0n
But our work is not done. Florida is close to passing legislation that restricts how teachers discuss LGTBQ+ issues in the classroom. We must pass the federal Equality Act. Ahora.
Last week, I voted for the Global Respect Act to protect LGBTQ+ communities from persecution and abuse. I believe in respect and equal treatment for everyone.
Felicitaciones! Thank you to these courageous women for leading on the field and in the fight for #EqualPay. What an important victory. Adelante! https://t.co/8auKazPxqq

What a weekend on the campaign trail! From meeting with the NM @MachinistsUnion, to the Santa Fe, Rio Arriba, San Juan & Quay County Conventions.

I hope you had a wonderful holiday weekend with your families - with opportunities to appreciate the beauty & history of our state.☀️ https://t.co/Z4ob54MyQd

When underserved communities don’t have access to the ballot, it’s easy for lawmakers to ignore their needs and priorities.

We will continue the fight for voting rights.

I grew up outside in our beautiful Nuevo Mexico, running around with my family and friends, playing in our forests, mountains, and rivers.

I want future generations to be able to enjoy our breathtaking Land of Enchantment. We must protect New Mexico.

Happy Presidents' Day, mi gente! 

Today we honor our past leaders and their tremendous service to our country. Thank you @POTUS for your leadership and all the progress we have built together! https://t.co/9XaNQYkZ0X
If this pandemic has taught us anything, it’s the importance of access to quality and affordable healthcare. The time to expand healthcare is NOW. ¡Ahora es cuando!

Thank you to the NM State Council of the @MachinistsUnion for having me this afternoon and for all you do for NM’s working families! Together we will  make sure our workers have the protections and opportunities they deserve. #UnionStrong https://t.co/TsplxZANmr
With your help, I will keep getting work done for #NM03: https://t.co/bZ5K9pVReI

Here are 3 things I believe: 
1️⃣ Ahora es cuando to stand up for what you believe in
2️⃣ We must act to protect what we love
3️⃣ Be the change you want to see

That’s why I ran for Congress in the first place & why I’m running for reelection.

Last week, the New Mexico Senate PASSED a bill that would increase teacher salaries. This is an important leap forward in the nationwide movement for better teacher pay. We must keep going. 

Teachers are the backbone of our communities & must be treated as such.

Shelter is a fundamental human right, and we must provide access to affordable housing for EVERYONE in #NM03. 

In Congress, I am fighting for funding to do just that.

Can you chip in just $6 and help me continue serving Nuevo Mexico? 
https://t.co/Ko6BV4P1uS

Our communities mean so much to me. From growing up in Las Vegas, to serving tribal communities as an attorney, to serving in Congress today, nuestra gente have always been my priority. 

My campaign is all about you, and I can’t stay in Congress without your support.

Today is Random Act of Kindness Day, and I believe kindness should be at the core of everything we do. 

Let's spread love and treat each other with kindness and respect, mi gente. ❤️

The pandemic has been difficult for all of us, especially our educators. Still, they go above & beyond to care for our children.

When our teachers suffer, we all suffer. We must invest in our education system - and this begins with better national teacher pay.

Republicans only need 5 seats to take back control of the House

All the progress we’ve made in areas like public education, support for small businesses, investments in our rural communities, climate policy, & voting rights would reach a standstill. We can’t let that happen.

Last year we passed a historic investment of $12 billion in Indian Country including investing in water projects, broadband, climate resiliency, and the Indian Health Service.

We are going to uphold our treaty obligations and invest in our Native communities.

Thrilled to be joining @jamie_raskin and @NatlDemSummer for #DemocracySummer this year! If you or a young person you know is looking for a way to get involved in our democratic process this summer - please apply to join us! 

Application is here: https://t.co/zF2CEBpLPs https://t.co/6PCEOEQVXu

I am honored to be endorsed by @NARAL. All people have the right to make their own decisions about their health and futures with their families, their doctor, & their faith - without government interference. I am dedicated to defending that right. https://t.co/Co5cOrmZ0w
Will you show your support by contributing just $7 to my campaign? https://t.co/sB621YuCXg
I am running for reelection because my family taught me that now is always the time to be of service to our communities. I believe in the people of NM, and I hope you believe in me. Ahora es cuando!

Happy Valentine's Day, from my family to yours! Love is infinitely expansive. I believe that love should be at the center of our politics and our policy - and today is an important reminder to celebrate all those we love.

Today we remember the 17 souls we lost in Parkland.  

May we honor their memory by advocating for gun safety laws that keep our children and schools safe. This kind of tragedy should never happen again.

Huge congratulations to NM artist and former Pojoaque Governor George Rivera for his beautiful art commissioned by the Pechanga Tribe honoring the traditional Native American sport of Shinny which is displayed at the SoFi Stadium & welcomed guests of today’s #SuperBowl #nmproud https://t.co/Yqffnc6Gvz
Happy #GalentinesDay to the hermanas who serve the communities we love - from NM to DC - and all the young women leaders of the future! #womenlead https://t.co/NOZjpzHspe

Prescription drug costs are ridiculously high. My constituents across New Mexico tell me about the outrageous costs of insulin and EpiPens. It's time we allow Medicare to lower prescription drug costs. Ahora es cuando!

There’s a reason Mora and amor have the same letters - because Mora is where the heart is! ❤️

Kicking off the weekend de San Valentín with the passionate democrats of Mora County. https://t.co/YrCyiKDY0r

We're going to fix our infrastructure across the board. From broadband to water, to our roads and bridges, with the Infrastructure Jobs & Investment Act, we will put Nuevo Mexicanos to work to #BuildBackBetter.
And muchísimas gracias as always to my hermano Steve for the music! #lasadelitas https://t.co/QPHdqc6piF

It’s always a great day to be home in Las Vegas - and convention season means fresh tortillas from Charlie’s Spic and Span!

Thank you San Miguel County for showing up every time. Adelante! https://t.co/88csph0h7m
Ahora es cuando! #WomenInSTEM https://t.co/CmfULxKKqY

Happy 106th Anniversary to Bandelier National Monument! ❤️ Bandelier’s history goes back 10,000 years to the Ancestral Pueblo people. Honoring indigenous heritage and culture means honoring sacred lands. https://t.co/IeiVdfNRKe
I’m proud of my Latina herencia y cultura. We should celebrate our differences instead of using them to drive us apart. We are stronger together. Juntos podemos.

With the America COMPETES Act, Democrats are continuing to deliver para la gente & make the US economy more competitive. 

It includes $52 billion to invest in semiconductors (like those made in NM) & create jobs across the country. Now, the Senate MUST pass it. #MakeItInAmerica
My heart is with his family, his friends and his city as we all mourn.

Santa Fe and NM weep for the loss of former Santa Fe Mayor Javier Gonzales. A dedicated New Mexican, Javier was a trailblazer, advocate, friend, and beloved father. Our children are friends. The Gonzales familia represents so much of what is good about our beloved community.

In the last weeks, @POTUS has made enormous strides to combat COVID across the country. Americans now have access to free COVID tests mailed to their homes and 400 million N95s are being distributed across the country. #DemocratsDeliver

In December 2020, the unemployment rate in the US was at 6.7%. In December 2021, it was at 3.9% - one of the most significant decreases to unemployment under any President in history. We will keep growing jobs so Americans can get back to work and support their families.

Last year, I introduced a resolution to recognize the disparity in wages paid to Latinas and reaffirm Congress’ dedication to equal pay. The fight for equal pay has been a long one, but I am not backing down.

We need to bring costs down for everyday New Mexicans. From everyday items to housing, education, and healthcare costs. These costs have been skyrocketing for years, it's time we put an end to that. Ahora es cuando!

Our hearts break with each headline of a promising young person lost to an overdose. Families should never have to experience the pain of losing a loved one to substance misuse, and we must do everything we can to prevent it.

➡️ Requires the Department of Education and the Department of Health and Human
Services to identify & promote successful programs
➡️ Revitalizes a grant program to help institutions implement programs

The Campus Prevention and Recovery Services for Students Act:
➡️ Promotes evidence-based prevention & intervention strategies on college campuses
➡️ Encourages integration & collaboration in campus-based health services to address substance misuse & mental health

Substance use & addiction is an epidemic in the US, especially among college students. I introduced the bipartisan Campus Prevention & Recovery Services for Students Act to help institutions support students & prevent alcohol & substance misuse on-campus. 🧵👇
$5 goes a long way in a community-funded campaign like mine. Can I count on you?https://t.co/eVUoq8eXe6
My campaign is all about New Mexicans. The issues that matter most to you and your loved ones. We don’t rely on corporate PAC money but on the hardworking gente of NM.

Childcare costs are increasing every year, and it's going to take a historic investment to bring them down.

You can't be pro-family or pro-jobs without supporting affordable childcare.
No one should have to choose between paying the rent and picking up a prescription. Our families shouldn't have to make these difficult economic decisions to survive. ¡Ahora es cuando!

The Infrastructure Jobs and Investment Act is bringing over $335 million for water infrastructure development and $100 million for drought resiliency to New Mexico. We're going to protect our precious water resources, porque agua es vida. #DemsDeliver
https://t.co/maVahj8bHw

The US economy added 467,000 new jobs in January! This builds on the fastest job growth on record of 6.6 million new jobs created in 2021.

Despite facing the omicron surge, President Biden's economic plan to create an economy that works for everyone is delivering. #DemsDeliver
Visit https://t.co/onK2f9PPMM to take action & pledge your support. "

Over 2 years, 4 members of my family were diagnosed with cancer. I am the only one still living today.

As a breast cancer survivor & a member of one of NM's many families marked by cancer, I am dedicated to building awareness, prevention, detection, & treatment. #WorldCancerDay

Happy 108th birthday to Rosa Parks! Her leadership during the Civil Rights Movement changed history and shaped the world we live in today. May we honor her memory by speaking truth to power, and never giving up in the struggle for what is right.

In Congress, I fought for mi gente! I secured investments for small businesses hit by the pandemic and delivered over $230 million to small businesses, restaurants, & venues across New Mexico. https://t.co/b9uwhXJO3z

Growing up in a small town and as a former small business owner, I know the value of small businesses for our communities. So when many businesses suffered the economic burden of this pandemic, I knew I had to do something.

While we desperately need and welcome the moisture brought by this storm - driving conditions across #NM03 and the state are still difficult this morning. Please be careful, and follow @NMDOT and check out https://t.co/WUp7nGeAom for updates on driving conditions.

Across the country,  Latinos, African Americans, Native Americans, Asian Americans, and rural communities struggle to access the ballot. But, there is a light at the end of the tunnel for voting rights -- and it begins with the Senate passing the Voting Rights Bill.
The 15th amendment says no citizen shall be denied the right to vote because of their race, but 152 years after the amendment was ratified, people of color continue to experience discrimination.

I used to be a tribal attorney, and I dedicated decades of my career to fighting for tribal sovereignty. As Chair of the Subcommittee for Indigenous Peoples and your representative in Congress, I promise to continue fighting for tribal rights and protections.

You shouldn't lose your job just because you're sick. You shouldn't be worried that employees at a store are sick on the job. We're two years into a pandemic - our communities need paid sick leave. Ahora es cuando!
¡Felicitaciones, Priscila! ¡Avanzamos con Latinas! 👏🏽👏🏽👏🏽 #lawtinaslead https://t.co/IaOMFrakzH

Everett. We were a team for many years. I love him still. He inspires us still. I miss our 6:30am calls while he was working his fields and excited to share a plan or proposal. We miss you, Governor, but your wisdom carries us forward and your family makes us all proud. https://t.co/nCbPzakgow

We are sending love not worries, and blessings from nuestra Virgen to our brother @benraylujan. We look forward to a quick and full recovery for our dedicated Senator who is devoted to our communities.

Black History is American History. Today marks the beginning of #BlackHistoryMonth. Let’s both honor Black history and act to address injustice and inequities still facing this beloved community in NM and across our nation.

From Farmington to Santa Fe to Raton to Roswell, the Navajo Nation, the Jicarilla Apache Nation, and Pueblos across our beautiful state - I am so grateful to you all for helping me file to get on the ballot today to keep fighting for the communities we love. Adelante!
4,500+ signatures. 145 volunteers. 18 counties. One vibrant community-based campaign for #NM03 https://t.co/eIx4JWWPxo
Happy #LunarNewYear! Wishing all who are celebrating and your families health, happiness and good fortune in the #YearOfTheTiger and beyond.
Feliz cumpleaños, Hermana! @MelanieforNM 💜 https://t.co/jymLm5SA7l

¡Lo hicimos! Tomorrow is the deadline for petition signatures! We could not have done this without our campaign community of volunteers across all 18 counties of #NM03. Thank you for your support and dedication! https://t.co/Pubb94xaUZ
We have 3 DAYS LEFT until the petition deadline. Visit https://t.co/2yBonuwdmK to download a copy of my petition and contact the campaign at info@teresaforall.com to arrange pick-up!

Our petition deadline is just 5 DAYS AWAY! If you or anyone you know hasn’t signed my petition yet, you can go to https://t.co/2yBonuwdmK to download your copy. 

Please reach out to the campaign at info@teresaforall.com & we can pick it up! https://t.co/knXHPzsY7i

The RECA compensates those New Mexicans who have suffered generations of cancer & other diseases related to nuclear testing & uranium mining. We will not rest until these families get the just compensation they deserve.
In collaboration with the leadership of the Tularosa Basin Downwinders, I introduced the bipartisan Radiation Exposure Compensation Act Expansion bill this Congress alongside @BenRayLujan

But we also remember that today falls short by only referring to those downwind of the Nevada testing - when the United States tested atomic bombs across the country creating downwinders in many states, including those near the very first atomic bomb test in New Mexico.

Today, on this National Day of Remembrance for Downwinders, we remember all those individuals, families, & communities who suffered long-term harm due to unsafe testing of the first nuclear bomb in 1945.

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay #WeRemember the 6 million Jews & millions more killed by the Nazi regime. 

We recommit to fighting for a world free from Anti-Semitism & all forms of hatred & bigotry - a world where we use love to create rather than hate to destroy. #NeverForget

We know that #DemocratsDeliver for our rural communities across New Mexico. We got energized with the Curry and Roosevelt County Democrats last night! And next time you’re at Leal’s in Clovis - check out the “Teresa Special”! https://t.co/ym8f2ACZ3a

Gracias, Hobbs! I’m grateful for the hospitality and generosity of Democracy Heroes like Trish and Gene, and excited to continue getting to know and learn from the vibrant families and communities joining #NM03 https://t.co/bjWneZm4SP

We need to bring costs down for New Mexicans. From everyday items to housing, education, and healthcare costs - we need change across the board. These costs have been skyrocketing for years, it's time we put an end to that. Ahora es cuando!

Our rural communities are full of opportunity and we also face unique challenges. Our communities need reliable internet access, clean water, and safe infrastructure. I will never forget about rural America or where I come from, and I will always support ALL of our communities.

We have one week until our petition signatures are due! 

We're collecting signatures from Gallup, to Las Vegas, to Roswell. Go to https://t.co/2yBonuwdmK to print and sign the petition and mail it back before our deadline!

Thank you Roswell and @StellarCoffeeCo for a wonderful morning - and some extraterrestrial sights! It was wonderful to kick off my Roswell campaign on Main Street in Roswell’s living room - and I’m looking forward to being back soon for the @NMDEMS state convention! #nmpol https://t.co/O1vJWGhg9L

Attacks on voting rights aren't just partisan, they're un-American. So let's be on the right side of history, stand up for what is right and protect the heart of our nation - our democracy. We will not give up - the fight continues. Adelante.

Muchísimas gracias, Los Alamos! What a great day getting activated and celebrating democracy with some of my favorite Democratic women - @NMSOSMaggie, @SGR4NM, and @Christine4nm! #electwomen #nmpol https://t.co/J19K3sW1QB
All people deserve access to health care and the freedom to control our own bodies and our own lives. Abortion is health care and abortion access is essential.

It's been 49 years since the Supreme Court recognized the constitutional right to an abortion in Roe v Wade. We shouldn't still be having this fight for our basic rights - but sadly we are. It's time for the Senate to pass the Women's Health Protection Act.

Every day I'm working in Congress to protect what we love: our democracy, our communities, and the beautiful place we call home. But I can't do this alone. 

Our ballot petition deadline is in 10 days! Go to https://t.co/2yBonuwdmK to sign to get my name on the ballot again.

.@BOLDDems was critical to my first election, and I am proud to stand beside them as we work to build greater representation for Latino communities and deliver para la gente across the country. ¡Adelante! https://t.co/gcYORxFkYU

And in New Mexico we have:

 ✅  Created 43,300 jobs since the beginning of the Biden Administration
 ✅  Helped start 6,960 new businesses
 ✅  Sent $2.6 billion in direct relief to NM families
 ✅  And invested almost $1 billion in NM’s public schools

One year ago President Biden was sworn in. Since then Congressional Democrats have:

 ✅  Passed a historic investment in our infrastructure
 ✅  Ramped up our vaccination efforts
 ✅  Created more than 6 million new jobs
 ✅  And more https://t.co/MBTuKNSsKD
We will not stop fighting for the future of our democracy. Disappointment is finite - but hope is eternal!

¡Atención! Our signature petition deadline is in under 2 weeks! This is how we will make sure I get back on the ballot so we can continue to work to serve our communities here in #NM03. 

Share this video with your friends and then sign the petition at https://t.co/2yBonuwdmK https://t.co/xNfrUqnfBl

Great to spend time - and paint! - this weekend with @NEA_NM leaders and welcome @NEAToday VP Princess Moss to NM. We fight for the things we love - and we love our children, our educators, and our democracy #respectnmeducators https://t.co/iUhJw5lr69
Thank you for the love in today's paper, @woreservations ❤️ https://t.co/YrDEc2mlsi https://t.co/sUO0V3DHim
It is by pushing together that we bend the arc of history towards justice. Adelante. #MLKDay2022 https://t.co/d7LezoXKIC

Las Vegas will always be home - “todos vuelven a la Tierra en que nacieron.” San Miguel County launched my campaign 2 years ago & taught me the lessons of community & service that I carry with me every day. Thank you for always showing up & for the petition signatures! Adelante! https://t.co/FUanWYUn1F

I have always said that I will protect what we love, and in New Mexico we love our diverse communities. From our Native and Indigenous communities to our rural communities & small towns like my hometown of Las Vegas, I will always advocate for us all. Para todos. Para la gente.

In addition to getting vaccinated & masking - if you are able, donating blood is an important way to protect our communities during this surge. Please consider giving blood today - you can learn more at https://t.co/klMNeYxD8t or https://t.co/ilH6aOp8ww

https://t.co/NBCOlAa7Ep
Reach out to the campaign or the @SantaFeDems for info on how to sign our petitions! #nmpol

Mujeres helping mujeres get on the ballot! 💪🏽

I’m so grateful to Representatives @tara4nm, Linda Serrato & @ARomero_NM for joining us today to kick off 2022! We are gathering signatures to get on the ballot to run for reelection & keep delivering for our beloved NM. #electwomen https://t.co/JUMapQH3xv

How it started —> how it’s going

When out campaigning, you’ve got to stop at El Parasol for some chicken tacos - and petition signatures! #nmpol https://t.co/IlBZMZuOPA

In Congress, I've introduced legislation and secured funding to protect our environment and grow our economy in New Mexico. We're going to clean up our orphaned wells, preserve our precious water resources, and create clean jobs.
Every child deserves to thrive, not just survive. Families deserve a permanent child tax credit. Our communities need the child tax credit to be made permanent.
Last year dozens of bills passed in state legislatures that restrict voting access. It is time to pass federal legislation to protect the freedom to vote. Let's protect our precious democracy.
I voted for the #FreedomToVoteAct and the #JohnLewisVotingRightsAct today to protect our democracy. It's time now for the Senate to do the same! Ahora es cuando! #FightforVotingRights
New Mexico has capped insulin costs, but prescription drug costs are still rising across the board. It's time for Medicare to be able to negotiate and lower prescription drug costs. Ahora es cuando.

For years, many sacred, tribal cultural items not meant for commercial use were stolen, exported, and sold to the highest bidder. These cultural items should be with those who create them and know how to revere and protect them.

Now it's time for the Senate to pass the STOP Act.
Last year the House passed my bipartisan Safeguard Tribal Objects of Patrimony Act, the STOP Act. This legislation will stop the trafficking of sacred Tribal cultural patrimony. #Thread

I am proud to represent our beautiful and beautifully diverse district. But last year the GOP put our district on their target list. Now the new maps have made #NM03 "highly competitive."

We can't take this seat for granted. Please retweet and follow to grow our campaign.
Our waters are precious and every New Mexican deserves clean water. Porque agua es vida.

We must join forces to pull back the dagger at the throat of democracy. That means passing the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act. Voter suppression, voter intimidation, and threats to election workers threaten the bedrock of our democracy.
The Upper Pecos watershed is essential to so many communities across New Mexico. We will protect it and ensure every New Mexican has clean water, porque agua es vida. https://t.co/FfvYG0s8Tc

Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, over 2 million more Americans signed up for affordable healthcare last year - but we still have work to do. Every New Mexican deserves affordable, quality healthcare. Because healthcare is a human right.

We can afford universal pre-k, affordable childcare, and lower healthcare costs. And we can do it without raising taxes on middle-class families. It's time for the ultra-wealthy to pay their fair share.
Last year we created over 39,000 jobs for Nuevos Mexicanos in our district. This year, we're going to create even more. Our communities deserve good-paying jobs.

Nina Otero-Warren was a suffragist, the 1st Latina ever to run for the US Congress, and a leader in the movement for bilingual and equal education. 

She joins 4 other trailblazing women on the quarter this year. 

¡Que viva, Nina - y Voto para la mujer!

https://t.co/28GAHmFBLs

Are you a registered Democrat in #NM03? Have you signed our reelection petition yet? Ahora es cuando!

Email info@teresaforall.com to get a petition sent to you and for more information.

Thanks to the Santa Fe County Dems for the photo and to our volunteer Cindy! #nmpol https://t.co/7BEolf9snB
Feliz Día de los Reyes! Today is Three Kings Day - and my beloved late father Ray's birthday, named for the holiday. Wishing a blessed Epiphany to all who are celebrating around the world!
Feliz cumpleaños, querido Nuevo Mexico! Singing you Las Mañanitas today.💛❤️

#January6th was a violent attack on our democracy & an attempt to overturn an election. But democracy won.  We must remember how precious & how vulnerable our democracy is & that it is all of our responsibility to protect it. Protecting our democracy isn't partisan, it's American

Our community-based campaign is strong because of your generous support. Thanks to you, this has been our best fundraising quarter to date in our reelection campaign! ¡Muchísimas gracias! https://t.co/zrQbqJQ0xs

78k families in my district received the Child Tax Credit. That's $207.9 Million invested in lifting children out of poverty. We can't pull this rug out from under our families. We must extend the Child Tax Credit!

"Teresa is a steadfast champion for New Mexico in Congress - for women, children, and families, for our environment and rural communities, for voting rights, and so much more. I'm proud to work alongside her and to endorse her in her reelection campaign. - @MelanieforNM https://t.co/gaffCM8OLi

"I am proud to serve New Mexico alongside my friend Teresa Leger Fernandez. We need Teresa's continued leadership for working families and rural communities like the ones we grew up in. I am proud to endorse her today." - @benraylujan https://t.co/MdhAvRXZ92

"Teresa Leger Fernandez is a steadfast leader and true public servant to her constituents. I’m proud to work with her in New Mexico and in D.C. — and I’m proud to endorse her for re-election." - @TeamHeinrich https://t.co/knstmOPz6u

"Rep. Leger Fernandez is a champion for families across NM. In her first term, she secured billions of dollars for infrastructure, education & tax credits for our state's families. I am proud to endorse her so she can continue to help all New Mexicans thrive." 
- @Michelle4NM https://t.co/Mb5lLskEjX

I'm honored to receive the endorsement of these critical New Mexican leaders for my re-election campaign. Together, we are making New Mexico a better place for future generations. Adelante! https://t.co/weygLB4sgW

$0 in corporate money is fueling this campaign. 

This is a campaign by la gente and for our communities—not by and for special interests.
New Mexico has thousands of orphaned wells. That's why last year I secured $4.7 billion to clean up our orphaned wells. This year we'll get to work cleaning them up. Ahora es cuando.

In 2021 I introduced legislation to put our creative economy back to work, clean up our orphaned wells, compensate those communities harmed by radiation exposure, and stop the trafficking of Tribal patrimony. 

In 2022 we're going to sign them all into law.

Nuevo Mexicanos carry a deep love and respect for our state. That's why I've introduced legislation to protect this beautiful place we call home.

We will protect our precious water resources, expand our wilderness areas, and fully fund the Historic Preservation Fund.

Last year #DemocratsDelivered a historic investment in our infrastructure and the lowest unemployment rates in decades. This year, it's time to bring down prescription drug costs, pass affordable childcare, and continue lowering costs for working families.

¡Feliz año nuevo! 

Wishing you and yours a Happy New Year. May you find joy and peace in 2022. https://t.co/IQ49s2GaGP
We have work to do in 2022 to protect what we love: our democracy, our environment, and our communities. And I know we're not done working yet. ¡Adelante!

2021 has been a complicated year. We passed historic legislation like the American Rescue Plan and the Infrastructure Jobs & Investment Act. But we also saw our democracy attacked on Jan 6th and voter suppression bills passed across the country.

We are so close to hitting our end-of-year goal. Just $2,309 to go! Share this video and then chip in below to show the GOP that #NM03 is not up for grabs.
https://t.co/yR2HAnQn54 https://t.co/NSNzx2kvpy

We have to show the GOP this district won't be flipping red anytime soon. Our end-of-year deadline is here. Can I count on you to chip in whatever you can today? 
https://t.co/BKOX3cVnUn

I've never backed down from a challenge before. Now the GOP is targeting my seat and 538 moved our race to "highly competitive" after the new maps were drawn, but that doesn't scare me. I'm ready to continue serving and protecting our communities and I'm not done yet.
🙋🏻‍♀️ count me in! https://t.co/RLahGqorbA
Donate to join our community-based campaign: https://t.co/96Abdoohkt

Republicans are targeting our district, #NM03. We will show them that our communities aren't up for grabs. They're waiting for our end-of-year fundraising deadline to see if they can flip this seat. Let's show them they're wasting their time. Share & chip in below.

2021 has seen an ongoing and relentless attack on reproductive rights from Republican state legislatures across the country.

Politicians have no place in personal healthcare decisions. Ahora es cuando to pass the Women's Health Protection Act. #AbortionisHealthcare https://t.co/hQWToyEdcK

In 2021 we've expanded healthcare subsidies and lowered prices, but there's still much work to do.

We still need the Senate to pass the plan to lower prescription drugs. In 2022 the work continues.

One of my top issues in my first year in Congress has been preserving our precious water - porque Agua es Vida. 

From Upper Pecos to our acequias, I will always work so that every New Mexican has clean water - for generations to come.

This week, President Biden signed the historic infrastructure bill into law. If we truly want to stop climate change, we need to pass the #BuildBackBetter plan as well. There's no planet B and there's not a second to waste.

We face a potentially permanent loss of history and culture.

Water is life — agua es vida — and acequias are at the heart of our farming communities. They deserve a secure future — they deserve to know that this generation is not the last.

This issue is close to my heart. Earlier in my career, I served as a lawyer to defend acequias from developers. But now we face additional threats. If they fail, we face the end of a way of life that has prevailed among our communities since before this country was founded.

Farmers and community members are fighting for the future of acequias and water rights in New Mexico, but they can’t do it alone. We need to take action at a societal level to tackle the threat of climate change. There is no more time to waste.

But now, climate change is drying up the water and endangering the livelihoods and self-sufficiency of so many families who’ve relied on the acequias for generations.

A rising global temperature will continue to affect our acequias — the hotter the climate, the drier the canals.

Agua es vida.

Here in New Mexico, we have a centuries-long tradition of communities living along acequias — communal irrigation systems that sustain families and crops even here in the desert. #Thread

Orphaned wells across New Mexico threaten our health and our environment. I wrote legislation to fix this, and now it's part of the Infrastructure Bill and Build Back Better Act. We're going to finally protect our environment without leaving any community behind. Ahora es cuando!

For too long, communities across our state have struggled to get affordable and reliable broadband. Over 20% of New Mexicans don't have adequate broadband access. The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act will change that.

We must pass the #BuildBackBetter Act to make paid family leave a reality for all Americans. New Mexico’s families deserve nothing less.
